title: Bluetooth LE auto connection timeout
body: Currently a Bluetooth LE device that advertises with a 7 second pinging interval won't automatically reconnect to a windows phone, 6 seconds seems to be the magic number (this is from a background task trying to reconnect after a link loss, e.g. in the keep the keys example).  Please extend this to be the Maximum time that the Bluetooth spec allows between pings to maintain a connection (which is 32 seconds), or atleast make it greater than 6 seconds so that very low power Bluetooth devices can be made.  The phone can manually initiate a connection with greater values, but the background task won't automatically reconnect.
